com.reactivecascade.reactive.ui

Class MirrorArrayAdapter.MirrorDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.reactivecascade.rest.AbstractRESTService<K,V>
      • com.reactivecascade.rest.MirrorService<java.lang.Integer,V>
        • com.reactivecascade.reactive.ui.MirrorArrayAdapter.MirrorDelegate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INamed
    Enclosing class:
    MirrorArrayAdapter<V>

    public class MirrorArrayAdapter.MirrorDelegate
extends MirrorService<java.lang.Integer,V>
    This can be attached to an upstream MirrorService to copy changes in the data model onto the screen. The idea it to manipulate the model (add remove sort) and let the UI copy that. The filter mechanism in ArrayAdapter should be sufficient for reactive searching within the displayed items. It is recommended to do manipulation indirectly through the up-mirror model and no direct changes to this view model. If you do need to change the model directly, subscribe changes to the MirrorDelegate would be preferred as they keep open the possibility of subscribing other MirrorArrayAdapters to this one and they receive the changes also (such as Filter. Changes made for example through ArrayAdapter.add(Object) are not thread safe and must be done from the UI thread. Changes made for example through AltArrayAdapter.addAsync(Object) are safe from any thread, but will not propagate to a downstream MirrorService. It is possible to subscribe for example several different mirrors for several different tabs on screen of other UI components. At the moment the use for this is to maintain 4 differently-sorted and differently-filtered views of the same list of cards.

    • Method Detail

      • index

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> index()
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: MirrorService
        This returns a list of the current keys in the service. It is a local state getValue that changes based on the logic of this service. It is not directly mirrored.

        It will return different values a different times based on mirroring split other state changes. Mirroring will ensure that downstream indexes that MirrorService.subscribe(MirrorService, java.util.Comparator) to this service will be eventually-consistent with the index split subsequent upstream key split getValue changes.

        Specified by:
        index in class MirrorService<java.lang.Integer,V>
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
